isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - REAR HOOD LOCATOR SUPPORT

svcsubproc.title: 9200 (Before July 1996) - Rear Hood Locator Support Adjustment In or Out
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 89 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To adjust the side of the hood in or out at the rear hood locator support (Item 3) to align the side of the hood with the side of the cab, use the following procedure.

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender extension (Item 5) and loosen the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 8) holding the bottom of the rear hood locator support (Item 3) to the mounting bracket (Item 6).
Push the bottom of the rear hood locator support (Item 3) in or out, as required, until the rear edge of the hood (Item 1) is even with the side of the cab (Item 4).
With the rear edge of the hood (Item 1) even with the cab (Item 4), hold the rear hood locator support (Item 3) in place on the mounting bracket (Item 6) and tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 8).

Release the hood latches (Item 2) and raise the hood. Loosen, but do not remove, the adjustment bolt (Item 8) fastening the top of the hood locator support (Item 3). Push the top of the hood locator support in or out as required, then tighten the adjustment bolt (Item 8).
Repeat procedure for other side of vehicle.
